notes: also refers to southern Italy when capitalized "Il Mezzogiorno"
common usage with preposition 'a' without an article.
also refers to the southern region when capitalized "Il Mezzogiorno"
example_sentence_italian: Il mezzogiorno è il momento della pausa.
example_sentence_english: Noon is the time for the break.
The noons in summer are hot.

notes: partitive plural form; contraction of di + i

example_sentence_italian: Il silenzio del mezzogiorno era totale.
example_sentence_english: The silence of noon was complete.

notes: contraction of a + il; more common without article as 'a mezzogiorno'
example_sentence_italian: La riunione è fissata al mezzogiorno.
example_sentence_english: The meeting is scheduled at noon.
They departed at the scheduled noons.

example_sentence_italian: Dal mezzogiorno in poi fa più caldo.
example_sentence_english: From noon onward it gets hotter.
From the summer noons we returned tired.

notes: contraction of in + il; can refer to the Mezzogiorno region when capitalized

example_sentence_english: I have memories about past noons.
